dialogue.text: Maybe I’ll see what Karin is up to?
I select Karin’s name in my phone and wait for her to pick up.
Given how embarrassed she was to even give me her number, I imagine she’ll let it ring a few times before-
Hello?
Oh, hey.
I wasn’t expecting you to pick up right away.
Oh! Uhh...hahah, yeah. I just kind of had my phone out and, you know...answered it. Yeah.
...Right.
Well, anyway, what are you up to right now?
Me? I was about to go to the park. Why?
Do you mind if I tag along?
Huh? Why?
You’re going there to jog or run or something like that, right? That sounds like a thing you would do.
Uh-huh...
Well, I’d like to sort of see you in action if I’m going to be in charge of you from now on.
In action?! Like, alone?? Can’t you just come watch us play at the field or-
One on one sessions are good for establishing relationships with your team.
And seeing as I already know Miku pretty well, you’re second in line.
Really? I mean, I guess that’s reasonable since I’m co-captain but...
I don’t know. Is it weird if I’m kind of...maybe a little happy to hear that? Hahaha...
It’s not weird at all. I’m excited to get to learn more about you.
Ah-! Yeah! I’m excited to learn more about me too! Ah, wait! I meant you! I already, um, know about...me...And-
Actually, is it okay if I just hang up now and meet you at the park?
I’m going to the one by the[school] and I’ll start heading over now if you’re ready.
Sure thing. I’ll see you soon, then.
Uh-huh! See you soon!
I really hope not.
I arrive at the park near[school] and find Karin standing near the fountain waiting for me.
G-Good evening!
Thanks for coming out to watch over me today...
Oh, wait! I meant watch me! Not watch over me! I can take care of myself!
I know what you meant, don’t worry.
In a sense, I might even need you to watch over me today.
Huh? What do you mean by that?
I’m not sure what Miku told you about me, but I don’t know much about sports.
I actually think it’s a little strange that she wanted someone like me to be your coach despite that.
It seems like the two of you take this pretty seriously, so I’ll try not to get in the way too much.
Well, it’s not like I {i}chose{/i} to go out of my way. I was dragged into this by force.
It’s okay if you don’t know much about sports. I...wouldn’t really mind teaching you.
We just...kind of need a teacher to be present in order to keep playing.
That’s...one of the several reasons I was surprised to hear you actually trying to get involved today...
Speaking of involvement, would you mind telling me a little about what you do here?
Nothing special, really. I just come here a couple times a week to run laps around the park.
It’s normally pretty quiet here on weekends since no one stops by on the way home from[school].
Well you’re already doing better than you normally do, so I’m proud of you.
Well, it’s not like I have a choice anymore, is it? You’re my coach.
If I can’t get over a hurdle as small as just looking you in the eyes, there’s no way I’ll be able to climb over anything else.
Just...try not to come too close too quickly or something because I probably won’t be able to prevent myself from having some weird reaction.
Noted. We should be practicing social distancing anyway in case some weird disease ever starts going around.
Hahah...Yeah, I guess we probably should...
Karin’s smile somehow manages to light up the world even in the midst of the sunset.
So...are you ready to start?
Yeah. I just need to run, right? Are you going to run with me?
You’re not really dressed for the task, so maybe you can just keep times for me instead?
I can’t imagine it’ll be very fun, but at least you won’t have to get all sweaty that way.
That sounds good to me.
I pull my phone out of my pocket and open up the stopwatch app.
Just hit the “lap” button every time I pass you, okay? That’s how I normally time myself. Just...with a tree instead of a teacher.
You don’t need to tell me my individual times. Just let me know how much faster or slower I am on each pass.
Endurance is important, so I need to make sure I’m able to keep up with myself more than anyone else.
Roger that. Official coach duties commencing now.
I hit the start button on the stopwatch and immediately send Karin spiraling into panic.
Ah- Sensei, wait! You didn’t even count me down! Start over!
No can do. Clock is already running. Go, Karin, go!
Ahh! Okay! I’m going!
Karin quickly takes off into a sprint to make up for a few seconds worth of lost time.
The way she runs is a lot different than Miku.
How was...that one?
Thirty seconds under your last. You’re not starting to lose steam, are you?
Of...course not! Watch me...closely this time!
And...that one?
I look down at my phone again to realize that Karin has actually beaten the time of her first lap.
I was so caught up in admiration that I didn’t even realize she was giving it her all that time.
Fifteen seconds up.
From the last one or from the best one?
The best one. Did you want to call it now? Or do you have a few more in you?
Heh...I could do this all day...
How the hell is she able to keep up that pace for so long without even looking phased?
If I were in her shoes, I’d be basically crawling right now.
Hah...
Karin comes to a stop several feet away from me after what I imagine is her last lap.
Okay...Now I’m done.
I thought you were planning on going all day?
Nah...I was...starting to feel bad for you.
You looked bored.
I wasn’t bored at all. If anything, I was actually having a good time watching you.
You’re really impressive, Karin. I think I get why you’re so involved with athletics now.
What?! No no no! I’m not that impressive. I just practice a lot.
Isn’t that the same thing? Most people don’t become great at anything without practicing.
Well, yeah, but like...I don’t know. Getting compliments from you feels weird. Hahaha...
Well you better get used to it, because I’m pretty sure this is going to be a regular occurrence from now on.
You...want to do this again?
I thought you were just trying to get acquainted with everyone on the team?
Isn’t it unfair to spend more time with me when there are other girls who need more help?
Karin makes a good point. But something she doesn’t yet understand is that I’m not just doing this because I’m trying to be a good coach.
I want to get closer to {i}her{/i} specifically. If I didn’t, I wouldn’t have called her out here today.
But that’s not something she needs to know yet.
Who even knows how someone as inexperienced and nervous around men would handle it if she were to hear something like that?
I definitely want to do this again.
Unless...you didn’t have fun hanging around me today?
Oh God! I’m forgetting how words work!
Well, believe it or not, I had fun too. And I’m really looking forward to doing this again.
Fun?! You had...but you...the stopwatch...ahhh!
Translation (Projected): Did you really have fun today, Sensei? All you did was stand around with a stopwatch...
Okay, okay. Calm down. Catch your breath.
Need me to rub your shoulders?
Shoulders?!
They’re the things your neck and your arms are connected to.
I know what they are! I’m just suddenly nervous again for some reason!
Karin takes another several minutes to calm herself down and get her eyes to go back to normal.
It’s strange.
Even though all I did was manage a stopwatch this afternoon, I feel suspiciously content.
Maybe I just really like when girls get nervous around me?
The confidence boost is definitely nice, but-
I don’t know.
What am I even saying?
I should just get on with my day...
{i}Karin’s affection has increased to [karin_love]!{/i}
